DOCNAME: CASE OF CAMINSKI v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE criminal charges were brought against CARDINAL people ( “ the defendants ” ) on suspicion of having caused grievous bodily harm to the applicant . On DATE an investigating judge of ORG ( “ the trial court ” ) opened an investigation against the defendants . According to statements taken on DATE as part of the pre - trial proceedings , the applicant sought damages for loss of income and injuries sustained . He stated that he would subsequently specify his claim .

CARDINAL . During the proceedings , the trial court fixed TIME hearings . Most of them were postponed because it could not secure the attendance of the defendants , their representative or witnesses . No adjournment of any of the hearings was ordered on the applicant ’s request . The trial court also obtained several expert opinions during the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the trial court found CARDINAL of the defendants guilty of grievous bodily harm and sentenced them to a suspended prison term . It further advised the applicant to pursue a compensation claim by means of a separate civil action . In this connection it observed that the applicant had hitherto sought compensation only for non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor appealed against the above - mentioned decision . At a public hearing held on DATE , ORG overturned the decision in respect of the sentence and confirmed the remainder . The CARDINAL defendants were sentenced to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . According to the Government , on DATE ORG confirmed this decision by dismissing the GPE appeal on points of law ( барање за вонредно преиспитување на правосилна пресуда ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought a civil action against the defendants and their employer , claiming compensation for the pecuniary and non - pecuniary loss he had sustained as a result of his injuries .

CARDINAL . On DATE the trial court ruled partly in favour of the applicant and ordered the defendants and their employer jointly to pay him MONEY ( equivalent to CARDINAL ) in respect of non - pecuniary damage . On DATE the defendants appealed . The case is pending before ORG .
CARDINAL . The statutory provisions relevant for the present case were described in the PERSON case ( see PERSON v. the former GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
